column4: Is there a command like MS-DOSs dir that gives the total space used by the files in the directory.  ls -l doesn't do this.
du
ty
you might use the -s option with that, too
if using bash, add this line to your .bashrc file:   alias dir='du -s'
but Da_Wrecka's point is valid ... check what dir does first
that alias might get used by scripts that expect another behavior (more like ls)
Thanks.  I did, and it did.
